rows.label: I needed to stock up / refill my alcohol supply
While shopping for groceries, I decided to pick up alcohol
I wanted to browse the store’s alcohol selection and ended up purchasing
I wanted to add a new bottle to my at‑home bar
I needed it for a specific gathering, party, or event
I saw it on social media and wanted to try
Someone told me I needed to try it
I bought it to make a specific cocktail
I thought my visiting family/friends would enjoy it

rows.label: It’s convenient / close to home or work
It offers the best prices or promotions
It has the best selection / variety

It was the only store open / available at the time
It’s my go-to place to purchase alcohol

It was the only place I could buy this type of drink

tables.questionText: Which best describes the reason for having a drink in the past week?

rows.label: A way to feel closer to others and strengthen bonds
A way to demonstrate that you have good taste
A chance to try something new
A way to celebrate or mark a moment / achievement
An escape from stress or routine
A way to keep the night going
A way to honor customs, rituals, or family traditions

tables.questionText: You said your reason for having a drink in the past week was best described as [pipe: S10a lower]. More specifically, what best describes that moment?

rows.label: A drink to bring everyone together at the start of the night
Something to sip while catching up with close friends
A drink that feels appropriate for the situation makes me feel like I fit in at a social gathering
A go-to choice for reconnecting with someone after time apart
A drink that makes me feel confident and put-together in social settings
Something that looks elevated or premium when served
A drink that feels on-trend or buzzworthy
A drink I'd be proud to post or share on social media
A drink I've never tried before that sparks curiosity
Something with a surprising twist—flavor, format, or origin
A limited-edition or seasonal release I want to experience before it's gone
A drink that transports me somewhere new—culturally or emotionally
A drink to toast a personal win or milestone
Something festive to share when good news hits
A way to make an ordinary day or night feel a little more special
A drink I reach for when I just want what I want
A drink that feels rich, extra, or over-the-top—in the best way
A drink to help me unwind after a long or stressful day
Something I reach for when I need a mental reset
A drink that helps me slow down and be present
A go-to when I want to escape the usual and feel transported
A drink that helps me feel confident and socially on-point for a night out
Something I choose when I want to bring my A-game to socialize
A go-to when I want to stay in control and keep the night flowing smoothly
A drink that's always part of our holiday or seasonal celebrations
Something I serve because it's what we've always had at family gatherings
A drink that helps keep a cultural or regional tradition alive
Something I choose because it reminds me of home or loved ones
A drink that feels like I'm treating myself

changes: s1: labels — cleaned and shortened answer labels to match survey text; removed repetitive question text from each row.

s1: nets — added synthetic multi-variable NET '_NET_S1_TERMINATE' that aggregates the three answer options that are programmed to TERMINATE (Advertising, Journalism, Marketing/Market Research). This highlights the screener exclusion rate.
s1: structure — indented the three terminating-item component rows under the NET for visual hierarchy; left other industry flags and 'None of the above' as top-level rows.
s1: metadata — set surveySection to SCREENER and added userNote '(Select all that apply)'.
s6a: labels - Shortened long datamap labels to the survey answer text (e.g., 'Mexico', 'Puerto Rico', etc.).
s6a: nets - Added a multi-variable NET ('_NET_S6a_AnyOrigin') that aggregates all S6ar1..S6ar8 to show respondents selecting any family origin. Components indented beneath the NET.
s6a: context - Populated surveySection as SCREENER, baseText to note this was asked of respondents who are of Hispanic/Latino origin, and added userNote '(Select all that apply)'.
s7: labels - Replaced generic row labels with survey answer text (removed variable prefixes).
s7: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyRace' combining S7r1..S7r6 (useful to show respondents who selected any race).
s7: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify multi-select format.
s7: questionText - Replaced 'S7' with full question text from survey.
s9: questionText updated to a clear verbatim question without variable prefix; row labels simplified to the short location text from the survey.
s9: mean_rows preserved (counts per location). No NETs or T2B added because this is numeric count data. Added baseText and userNote to clarify who was asked and response expectations.
a7_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnySubstance' combining A7r1,A7r2,A7r3,A7r4,A7r5. Cleaned and shortened row labels, left 'None of the above' as standalone. Marked table as derived.
a7_1: labels - Replaced long system/truncated labels with concise survey text for each binary flag.
a9_1: labels - cleaned question text and short labels to match survey wording; removed repeated reminder text.
a9_1: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_NotAlone_A9' aggregating A9r2..A9r7 as 'Not alone (NET)'.
a9_1: grouping - added header row to factor out common question stem and indented component rows under the NET for readability.
a9_1: userNote - added (Select all that apply; 'I was alone' is mutually exclusive).
a13b_1: labels - simplified long pipe-based labels to concise answer texts drawn from survey (e.g., 'Beer', 'Wine').
a13b_1: nets - added multi-variable NET row (_NET_A13b_OtherDrinks) that aggregates any selected 'other drinks' (netComponents: A13br1..A13br5).
a13b_1: userNote - added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify multi-select nature.
a13b_1: isDerived - set true because a synthetic NET variable was created.
a16_1: labels - Shortened and cleaned each option label to match survey text; removed redundant pipe text.
a16_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyPurchaseReason' combining A16r1..A16r10 to show respondents selecting any reason.
a16_1: isDerived - Marked table as derived because it includes a synthetic NET row.
a16_1: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)'.
a16_1: surveySection/baseText - Set surveySection to 'OCCASION LOOP' and baseText to indicate this was asked of respondents who purchased the drink (A14a=1).
a17_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET row (_NET_A17_AnyReason) that aggregates any selected reason (isNet:true, netComponents populated).

a17_1: labels - Cleaned and shortened row labels to match survey wording and removed pipe/autogenerated text. Added a concise questionText and userNote. Marked surveySection and baseText to reflect who was asked.
a19_1: labels - Shortened and cleaned repetitive suffix from each option to match survey text; made questionText descriptive.
a19_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A19_AnyReason' combining A19r1..A19r11 to show respondents who selected any reason (excludes 'None of the above').
a19_1: isDerived - Marked derived because NET row was added.
a19_1: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)'.
a19_1: surveySection/baseText - Populated from survey: SECTION A: OCCASION LOOP and 'Respondents who purchased the drink'.
a21: labels - Removed duplicate question prefixes; updated labels to match survey answer text (e.g., "Tito’s Handmade Vodka", "None of the above").

a21: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A21_AnyAwareness' (Any of these brands) combining A21r1-A21r6 to show overall unaided brand awareness. NET uses netComponents and an empty filterValue as required.
a21: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify multi-select format.

a21: readability - Kept individual brand rows and placed them under the NET (indent:1) for clear hierarchy; 'None of the above' left as standalone (indent:0). Marked table as derived because a synthetic NET row was added.
a22: exclude — Original flat overview excluded and split into attribute-specific tables for readability and analysis.
a22_premium: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Premium' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_approachable: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Approachable' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_authentic: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Authentic' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_generous: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Generous' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_edgy: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Edgy' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_independent: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Independent' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_bold: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Bold' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_reliable: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Reliable' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_down_to_earth: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Down-to-Earth' attribute (Select all that apply).
a22_sophisticated_refined: labels — Cleaned labels to brand names; derived table for 'Sophisticated / Refined' attribute (Select all that apply).
a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: labels - Expanded question text to full survey wording; normalized labels to sentence case and clarified neutral label.
a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup with indented component rows for 5 and 4.
a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: nets - Added Bottom 2 Box (1,2) rollup with indented component rows for 2 and 1.
a23_tito_s_handmade_vodka: context - Populated surveySection as OCCASION LOOP and added baseText and userNote to clarify who saw the item.
a23_grey_goose: labels - Replaced generic A23 label with full question text; updated row labels to match scale wording.
a23_grey_goose: t2b - Added Top-2-Box (4,5) and Bottom-2-Box (1,2) NET rows and indented component scale values underneath them for clarity.
a23_grey_goose: split/derive - Kept an additional table preserving the original flat scale rows (Full scale) so both box-score view and full-distribution view are available to analysts.
a23_grey_goose: metadata - Set surveySection to OCCASION LOOP and tableSubtitle to indicate this is the Grey Goose split.
a23_ketel_one: labels - Updated questionText to full verbatim question from survey and clarified row labels (made neutral label explicit).
a23_ketel_one: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup and Bottom 2 Box (1,2) rollup with component indented rows for full-scale detail.
a23_ketel_one: nets - Created B2B NET (1,2) and T2B NET (4,5); kept neutral (3) as standalone row.
a23_ketel_one: no_change - Treated as split table (rows correspond to Ketel One only) and preserved variable names.
a23_maker_s_mark: labels - Updated question text to full verbatim from survey and cleaned option labels ('Neither likely nor unlikely' capitalization adjusted).
a23_maker_s_mark: t2b - Added Top 2 Box (4,5) rollup and Bottom 2 Box (1,2) rollup with component rows indented beneath each NET to create a clear box-score presentation.
a23_maker_s_mark: split/subtitle - Marked tableSubtitle as 'Maker's Mark' to reflect this split (upstream process created brand-level table).
a23_maker_s_mark: survey alignment - Set surveySection to 'OCCASION LOOP' and added baseText and userNote to document that this question is shown only for brands selected in A21.
a23_casamigos: labels - Replaced generic 'A23' label with verbatim question text from survey.

s2: labels - Updated questionText to remove prefix and simplified row label to 'Age (years)'; clarified user note about screener terminations.
s2: no_change - Kept original mean_rows table (system will compute mean/median/std dev).

s3: labels - Question text updated to remove the question number prefix; answer labels verified against survey. No NETs or rollups created (demographic single-select). Added user note about termination behavior.
s5: labels - Replaced truncated/ambiguous labels with full income-range text from the survey document.

s5: nets - Added three meaningful NET rollups to improve analytical readability: Under $50,000 (1,2), Middle income $50k–$99,999 (3,4), High income $100k–$199,999 (5,6,7,8). Components indented under each NET.
s5: userNote - Added '(Select one)' to clarify response format.
s5: surveySection - Set to SCREENER based on survey location.

s6: labels - Question text cleaned to remove the question number prefix; answer labels verified against the survey and left as 'Yes' / 'No'. Added user note '(Select one)'. No NETs or rollups needed for a binary demographic question. Table retained as a single-frequency table.
s8: labels - Simplified and cleaned the question text into a concise questionText and updated the mean_rows row label to 'Number of alcoholic drinks in the past week (open numeric response)'.
s8: no_change - Kept original mean_rows table (system will generate mean/median/std/min/max/base). Added userNote clarifying 0 responses were terminated.

s8_dist_binned: derived - Created a derived frequency table with sensible bins: 1-2, 3-5, 6-10, 11+ (implemented as 11-50 to match allowed range). Marked as isDerived and added userNote and tableSubtitle.

s10a: Found in survey. Question text updated to remove the question number prefix and match survey verbatim. No NETs created to avoid making non-obvious conceptual groupings. Added user note '(Select one)'.

s10b: labels updated to match survey verbatim text from datamap (minor wording harmonization: 'close friends', 'feels rich, extra, or over-the-top—in the best way', and 'surprising twist—flavor, format, or origin'). s10c: userNote - added '(Select one)'; surveySection set to OCCASION LOOP; baseText added to clarify loop context

s11b: determined question is a categorical single-select within the Occasion loop; no T2B or box-score rollups applied.
s11b: no NETs created (groupings not meaningful / would be conceptual and not obvious).

a6: labels - Confirmed question text matches survey and standardized phrasing (removed trailing placeholder artifacts).

Note: two New Amsterdam entries and two Fireball entries exist in the datamap (values 3 & 44; 13 & 51) — preserved both but disambiguated in labels as '(1)' and '(2)' to avoid confusion in the table while retaining original variable/value mapping.
